titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 49: Breviary
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: Paper reinforcements pasted into gutters at fols. 30v-31r, 40v-41r, 41v-42r, 42v-43r, 43v-44r, 73v-74r, 74v-75r, 75v-76r; later prayers (eighteenth century?) pasted over text at fol. 5r; Inscriptions of similar date on upper and lower pastedowns; loose page fragment consisting of a lower third of a page inserted into book between fols. 29v and 30r
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2031, no. 39.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 55, no. 49.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a compact, early-fifteenth-century Breviary from Flanders or Cologne containing texts for the Little Office of the Virgin followed by the Seven Penitential Psalms and Litany (end lacking).

supportDesc.extent: 76, with two loose leaves (one original and one a later note); lacking end; 120 x 92 mm bound to 128 x 95 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

layoutDesc.layout: One column of nineteen lines; written area: 95 x 65 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: One large initial in gold and colors with foliate decoration within a trilateral border of leafy sprays; several smaller initials in gold and colors; capitals in red and blue; rubrication in red

binding.p: Contemporary vellum over wooden boards, remains of clasp

history.provenance: Leander van Ess (1772-1847), Darmstadt, no. 108; sold in 1824 to Sir Thomas Phillipps (1792-1872), no. 493; his sale, Sotheby's, London, June 6, 1910, no. 676; to Albert for John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
